Description: Ostracon, fragment from the body of a red-brown pottery vessel, fabric is grey in section, slightly ribbed, interior smeared with a resinous substance, with remains of at least five lines of Coptic text written in black ink, worn in places, on the exterior, containing a receipt.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.165)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36364) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36364)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 217 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
Miscellaneous number: SB XVIII 13410 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
